meanings.def: on or to the further side of something
examples: The road continues beyond the village up into the hills.
Our success was far beyond what we thought possible.
She's got nothing beyond her state pension.
It won't go on beyond midnight.
I know what I'll be doing for the next three weeks but I haven't thought beyond that.

meanings.def: used to say that something is not possible
examples: The bicycle was beyond repair (= is too badly damaged to repair).
The situation is beyond our control.

meanings.def: too far or too advanced for somebody/something
examples: The handle was just beyond my reach.
The exercise was beyond the abilities of most of the class.

meanings.def: to be impossible for somebody to imagine, understand or do
examples: It's beyond me why she wants to marry Jeff.

idioms.def: to be impossible for somebody to imagine, understand or do
examples: It's beyond me why she wants to marry Jeff.

meanings.def: on the other side; further on
examples: Snowdon and the mountains beyond were covered in snow.
The immediate future is clear, but it's hard to tell what lies beyond.
the year 2025 and beyond

meanings.def: (to do) even more than is expected or demanded
examples: Our staff members will go above and beyond to ensure that our customers are satisfied.

meanings.def: a place that is a long way from other houses, towns, etc.
examples: We stayed in some farmhouse in the back of beyond.

meanings.def: used when you are giving your opinion and emphasizing the point that you are making
examples: This meeting has been, without doubt, one of the most useful we have had so far.
Without the slightest doubt this is a remarkable exhibition.
She is without a doubt the best player I know.
